*Before attempting these questions, it is highly recommended that you read [Guide: Introduction to simultaneous equations](../studyguides/introtosimeqs.qmd).*

## Q1 {-}

Find how many solutions exist for the following sets of simultaneous equations.

1.1. $$\quad\begin{array}{ccc} x+2y & = & 4\\ 4x + 8y & = & 16 \end{array}$$

1.2. $$\quad\begin{array}{ccc} -2x+3y & = & 6\\ 4x - 6y & = & -12\end{array}$$

1.3
$$3x+4y=2$$
$$8x+2y=-1$$

## Q2 {-}

Solve for $x$ and $y$ in the following simultaneous equations using the substitution method.

2.1. 
$$-5x+y=3$$
$$3x+2y=12$$
 
2.2. 
$$4x+3y=20$$
$$6x-3y=12$$
 
2.3.
$$7x-2y=13$$
$$2x+3y=17$$
2.4. 
$$4x+y=9$$
 $$9x-y=4$$

2.5. 
$$3y=7-x$$
$$3x=4+y$$
 

## Q3 {-}

Solve for $x$ and $y$ in the following simultaneous equations using the elimination method.

3.1. 
$$8x+4y=10$$
$$2x-5y=3$$
 

3.2. 
$$5x+6y=19$$
$$4x-9y=6$$
 
3.3. 
$$7x-3y=20$$
$$3x+5y=9$$

3.4.
$$\frac{x}{2}+4y=3$$
$$\frac{y}{3}-2x=1$$
3.5
$$-y+1=\frac{3x}{2}$$
$$2x-\frac{y}{3}=5$$
 

## Q4 {-}

For the following sets of simultaneous equations, decide the best method (between the substitution and elimination method) and solve for $x$ and $y$.

4.1.
$$5x+2y=7$$
$$2x-y=4$$
 

4.2.
$$3x+4y=12$$
$$2x-2y=8$$
 

4.3.
$$x-7y=5$$
$$2x+5y=9$$


4.4
$$4x+3y=10$$
$$2x-5y=-1$$


4.5
$$x-3y=5$$
$$2x+5y=9$$
